Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.traversal

Class BFS

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.traversal.BFS
public class BFS extends Object
The BFS class implements the Breadth-First Search (BFS) algorithm for traversing or searching graph data structures. It operates by exploring the graph's vertices layer by layer, starting from a source vertex and visiting all its adjacent vertices before moving on to the next level of vertices.

This class is specifically designed for directed or undirected graphs represented using an adjacency list representation.

  • Constructor Details

    • BFS

      public BFS(int v)
      Constructs a Breadth-First Search (BFS) graph with the specified number of vertices. The graph is represented using an adjacency list.
      Parameters:
      v - the number of vertices in the graph

  • Method Details

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge(int v, int w)
      Adds a directed edge from vertex v to vertex w in the graph. This method updates the adjacency list to include w in the list of adjacent vertices for v.
      Parameters:
      v - the source vertex of the directed edge
      w - the destination vertex of the directed edge

    • traverse

      public List<Integer> traverse(int s)
      Performs a Breadth-First Search (BFS) traversal of the graph starting from the specified source vertex. The method visits all vertices reachable from the source vertex in a layer-by-layer approach and returns a list of visited vertices in the order they were traversed.
      Parameters:
      s - the source vertex from which the BFS traversal begins
      Returns:
      a list of integers representing the order in which vertices were visited during traversal
